{"step_by_step_thinking": "When gingiva is seen protruding out of the margins during rubber dam application, it is most likely due to edematous gingival tissues. Edema refers to the swelling caused by fluid accumulation in the tissues. This can occur in the gingiva due to inflammation or irritation. The other options, such as holes placed too far apart, using a light-weight dam, or holes placed too close together, are not typically associated with gingival protrusion during rubber dam application.", "answer_choice": "A"}
